definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
to form a long queue (idiom)/(of cars) to be bumper to bumper

sentences.english: It’s not appropriate to leave queues of taxpayers and go for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 放下排长队的纳税人去吃午饭这实在是不怎么合适。

sentences.english: People live aside usually go line up to buy its well-known juice ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 住在附近的人常常排长队购买它家有名的果汁冰淇淋。

sentences.english: There could be a long line at the ticket window.
sentences.chinese: 售票窗口可能会大排长龙。

sentences.english: The battalion formed up by companies on the barrack square.
sentences.chinese: 排长们在营房广场整理队伍。

sentences.english: Each day – even during the sweltering summer – thousands of visitors waited in long lines to enter Futurama.
sentences.chinese: 虽然烈日炎炎，但每天都有数千人大排长龙等待参观。

sentences.english: Outside, thousands of people formed up in long queues, waiting their turn to enter the hall.
sentences.chinese: 外面成千上万的人排长队等候进入大会堂。

sentences.english: Similarly, night clubs purposely make patrons wait at the door.
sentences.chinese: 同样的，夜店也会故意让常客在门口大排长龙。

sentences.english: We went to Yidu Railway Station accompanied by the woman platoon leader.
sentences.chinese: 女生排长随车陪送我们来到了益都火车站。

sentences.english: He had spent the summer after his freshman year in “platoon leader” training.
sentences.chinese: 他大一的暑假参加了“排长”训练。

sentences.english: I think our platoon leader doesn’t know and maybe like two dudes.
sentences.chinese: 排长可能不知道，但是他很喜欢那两个人。

sentences.english: you probably will have problems walking along this causeway because of the queues.
sentences.chinese: 沿着堤道走可能会有困难，因为会排长队。

sentences.english: Despite the long line of people that were already waiting in front of the shop, Nick lined up.
sentences.chinese: 尽管客人已在店前大排长龙，尼克还是排了队。

sentences.english: Power shortages remain an almost daily occurrence and long lines greet drivers buying fuel.
sentences.chinese: 电力短缺每日可见，司机为加油而大排长龙。

sentences.english: Some buildings advise patrons to arrive very early to pick up tickets to avoid long lines.
sentences.chinese: 有的售票处建议客人早些到当地取票，以免大排长龙。

sentences.english: You have to go there tomorrow. Today there must be long line at the barbershop.
sentences.chinese: 你还是明天再去吧，今天理发店里肯定排长队。

sentences.english: No wonder you do not see long queues at the tills in many of the shops here.
sentences.chinese: 难怪在许多店里都看不到收银台前排长龙的情形。

definition: warrant officer/petty officer/noncommissioned officer (NCO)/Japanese military officer
